Rip Notes
---------

Former Texas A&M student Casey Donahew said that they decided to do a live
recording because of the energy they get from crowds, which was apparent during
their performance on Feb. 27. They recorded their new album live at Bostock&#039;s in
Stephenville, but that&#039;s not all we can look forward to hearing on the album.

There are six new songs on the track. Two of the new songs were cut during the
live performance in Stephenville, while the other four were special tracks
produced in the studio. One of those being his current hit single, "Crazy,"
which he co-wrote with his wife Melinda.

Donahew also co-wrote with singer/songwriters Andy Pate and Scott Copeland.
Some of these songs include "Hunter S" and "Alabama Slammer," which Donahew said
is his favorite new song, because of the vibe it gives and its profound lyrics.
Donahew said he is proud of the new stuff. "The new stuff is definitely some of
the better writing that I&#039;ve done," Donahew said.

While Donahew said that his roots in Fort Worth inspired his distinctive
combination of classic country and rock and roll, as can be heard in his hit,
"Stockyards," he also expressed that his time here in Aggieland has also had a
big influence on his career as an artist.

"I have definitely written songs that have had to do with things that have
happened here in College Station," he said. "I draw my songs from life, whether
it&#039;s what&#039;s going on in my life, where I&#039;m at in my life or who I&#039;m around."

The band will also be busy non-stop for the next few months performing and
promoting their new album in places all over the nation such as New Mexico,
Oklahoma, Missouri, and Kansas, where they have already sold out shows much like
they do here in Texas.

It is clear that this hot band is headed to the top. Wherever the road may take
them, they are ready to go there rockin&#039; in style! "As long as people keep
listening, we&#039;re gonna keep doing what we do, which is playing, wherever it may
be," Donahew said.
